description: Dozens of names are floating around Mar-a-Lago as he forms his team
title: Here’s Who Trump May Tap to Drive His Economic Agenda

description: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto is set to meet his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping before heading to the US for a possible meeting with President-elect Donald Trump, balancing relations with the world’s two biggest economies in his first overseas trip.
title: Indonesia’s Prabowo to Visit Xi Before Possible Trump Meeting

description: President-elect Donald Trump named Susie Wiles, one of the top architects of his 2024 presidential campaign, as his White House chief of staff.
title: Trump Names Susie Wiles as White House Chief of Staff

description: US President Joe Biden will travel to Peru and Brazil next week for two international summits on a trip abroad that threatens to be overshadowed by President-elect Donald Trump’s election victory.
title: Biden to Travel to South America for APEC, G-20 Summits

description: In this Bloomberg Originals mini-documentary, we show how the president-elect’s planned trade salvos may not have the effect he intends.
title: Why Trump Faces a Losing Tech War Against China

description: The US military will obey “all lawful orders” and “continue to stand apart from the political arena” under Donald Trump’s administration, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said in a memo to personnel.
title: US Military to Stay Out of Politics, Austin Tells Forces

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Big Take DC producer Julia Press previews a discussion about how Fed Chair Jerome Powell might navigate a Trump White House.
title: Fed Chief Powell Girding for Political Pressure From Trump

description: Republican David McCormick defeated Democratic Senator Bob Casey in Pennsylvania, marking an upset that saw a former CEO of a hedge fund giant trounce a scion of a political dynasty in a year defined by appeals to the working class.
title: Ex-Hedge Fund CEO Defeats Senate Democrat Casey in Pennsylvania

description: Private prison stocks soared Wednesday and Thursday as the companies eyed a potential bonanza from President-elect Donald Trump’s pledge to carry out the largest mass detention and deportation of immigrants in US history.
title: Private Prison Stocks Soar After Trump Win on Deportation Plans

description: Japan’s potential kingmaker Yuichiro Tamaki faces a hazardous path as he looks to remain a power broker well beyond Monday’s vote to decide the fate of Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba.
title: Japan’s Tamaki Plays High-Risk Game With Weakened Premier Ishiba

description: President-elect Donald Trump said that Vladimir Putin wasn’t among the “probably” 70 phone conversations he has held with world leaders since winning the election, but that he still is planning to speak with the Russian president.
title: Trump Says He Spoke to Zelenskiy, Still Planning Putin Call

description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said he would not leave his post if asked by President-Elect Donald Trump.
title: Powell Says He Won’t Step Down as Fed Chair If Asked by Trump

description: Control of the US House continued to teeter on uncounted votes in about 30 congressional races Thursday, and the final tally will decide whether President-elect Donald Trump and Republicans have full grip on the government.
title: Battle for House Control Continues to Teeter on Uncounted Votes

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin congratulated Donald Trump on his victory in the US presidential election and said he’s ready to hold discussions with the new American leader.
title: Putin Says Trump’s Proposals on Ukraine Deserve Attention

description: France condemned the unauthorized entry of Israeli security agents into a French-owned church site in Jerusalem and their arrest of two consulate staffers.
title: France Condemns Israel’s Arrest of French Staffers in Jerusalem

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin congratulated Donald Trump on his recent victory in the US presidential election.
title: Putin Congratulates Trump on Winning US Presidential Election

description: Canada’s economy grew at a faster pace than initially estimated over the last three years, according to annual revisions by the country’s statistics agency.
title: GDP Revisions Show Canada’s Economy Growing at Faster Pace

description: Mozambique’s ruling party said the opposition’s calls for ongoing protests against the outcome of last month’s elections are inciting an attempted coup.
title: Mozambique’s Ruling Party Says Protest Calls Are Inciting Coup

description: New York is running short on time to implement congestion pricing in Manhattan after the election of Donald Trump, who opposes the novel tolling initiative.
title: NYC Congestion Pricing Faces Urgent Deadline With Trump Victory

description: Loyal supporters of the president-elect are poised to play a major role in his second administration.
title: Trump Win Gives Billionaire Backers Power to Shape Cabinet Jobs

description: US and European aid to Ukraine to the tune of €50 billion ($54 billion) that’s already been agreed is now an “open question” following the election victory of Donald Trump, Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said.
title: Orban Says €50 Billion Western Aid to Ukraine ‘Open Question’

description: Denmark’s Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen says a phone call with Donald Trump left her reassured that the US will continue to work with Europe on geopolitical issues after the president-elect takes office.
title: Trump Sounds Ready to Stay Engaged in Europe, Danish Leader Says

description: New York Democrats flipped a third US House seat after expensive and acrimonious races.
title: New York Democrats Flip Third House Seat in Long Island Race

description: Opposition party has dropped in polls from its previous highs
title: Irish Election Looks Like a Lost Moment for Crisis-Hit Sinn Fein

description: Salman Rushdie’s controversial 1988 novel The Satanic Verses could become available in India for the first time in decades after a court in Delhi said the government was unable to produce the original notification document that banned imports of the book.
title: India Ban on Rushdie’s ‘Satanic Verses’ May Ease on Legal Loophole

description: Donald Trump’s plan to impose large tariffs on Chinese exports could endanger US companies operating in Mexico, Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard warned as he braces for potentially difficult trade negotiations with the incoming US administration.
title: Mexico Says Trump Tariffs on China Would Endanger US Companies

description: A French trader who made millions of dollars on Polymarket bets that Donald Trump would win the US presidential election may have profited more than initially estimated, thanks to a network of accounts that have been newly linked to his activity.
title: New Analysis Boosts Trump Whale’s Polymarket Haul to $85 Million

description: Pipeline company Williams Cos. is optimistic that a return of a Trump administration and possible Republican legislative control will pave the way for permitting reform in the energy industry.
title: Williams CEO Optimistic That GOP Win Will Speed Pipeline Permits

description: Friedrich Merz has waited 25 years to become German chancellor and his best chance is now just months away.
title: Friedrich Merz’s 25-Year Wait for German Chancellorship Is Almost Over

description: A former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. executive is once again sitting at the top table of international economic policymaking.
title: ‘Government Sachs’ Is Back as Germany Promotes Goldman Alumnus

description: The Jawboner-in-Chief is back.
title: Social-Media King Donald Trump Is Coming Back to Rock Global Markets

description: President Joe Biden expressed hope Americans can “lower the temperature” and reaffirm their faith in the election system after a contentious campaign that saw Republican President-elect Donald Trump secure a sweeping victory.
title: Biden Calls for Healing Divides, Vows Peaceful Transfer to Trump

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said his country needs weapons to fight Russia’s invasion, not talk of concessions to the Kremlin, as Donald Trump’s victory cast uncertainty over future US support for Kyiv.
title: Zelenskiy Tells Europe He Needs Weapons Not Talk of Concessions

description: When Donald Trump is sworn in as the 47th US president, more than 1,500 Americans convicted or awaiting trial for the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol will be waiting to see if he fulfills a campaign pledge to pardon them.
title: Trump’s Win Spotlights Pledge of Mass Pardons for Capitol Attack

description: Donald Trump should call President Vladimir Putin to open up a line of communications with Russia and ultimately push toward a cease-fire in Ukraine, Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s top aide said.
title: Trump Should Call Putin to Push Ukraine Peace, Orban Aide Says

description: From his social-media network to real estate and crypto, the former president’s return to the White House will give him power to leverage his array of assets.
title: Donald Trump’s Billion-Dollar Windfall After Election Is Just the Start

description: Less than 24 hours after he was kicked out of Germany’s governing coalition, former Finance Minister Christian Lindner was struggling to explain what had happened.
title: Germany’s Self-Styled Tough Guy Can’t Process Scholz Fired Him

description: The European Union will explore new ways to finance massive investments in its militaries and in the development of clean technologies as Donald Trump’s return to the White House has accelerated efforts to boost the bloc’s own defense capabilities and to make its industries more competitive.
title: EU to Explore New Financial Tools as Trump Adds Pressure to Act

description: The return of rates volatility?
title: What a Trump Administration Means for the US Bond Market

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz rejected the conservative opposition’s demand that he should hold a confidence vote by early next week to pave the way for an election as soon as mid-January.
title: Scholz Rebuffs Opposition’s Demand for Confidence Vote Next Week

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s resolve to ease commercial frictions with nations from China to the US is about to be tested by a second presidential term for Donald Trump that could see the UK caught up in trade battles between global powers.
title: Starmer’s Free Trade Resolve Tested by Trump’s Zeal for Tariffs

description: Germany’s ruling coalition led by Chancellor Olaf Scholz imploded after months of infighting between his center-left Social Democrats, the climate-focused Greens and the pro-business Free Democrats.
title: Germany’s Government Collapsed — What’s Next

description: Nearly 200 nations will soon gather for the annual COP29 summit, where efforts to increase funding for poor countries and slash emissions will run against the reality of a hostile American president.
title: Trump Stranglehold Adds to Growing Doubts at Climate Talks

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping told Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim that the two nations should strengthen strategic ties and enhance mutual political trust in efforts to support their core interests.
title: Xi Calls for Closer Ties With Malaysia on New Energy, AI

description: The UK will significantly expand its sanctions on Russia’s industrial military complex, with the aim of disrupting the supply of vital equipment for President Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine.
title: UK Expands Sanctions on Putin ‘War Machine’ Beyond Ukraine

description: High energy costs and an uncertain transition to cleaner fuels have been a key driver behind Germany’s exodus of industrial giants in recent years. The ruling coalition’s sudden dissolution and looming snap election will only compound the problem.
title: Germany’s Looming Snap Vote Throws Wrench Into Energy Goals

description: India held its first official meeting with Taliban government’s defense minister in Afghanistan, after the group seized power three years ago amid a chaotic withdrawal of the US forces.
title: India Holds First Talks With Taliban Defense Chief to Boost Ties

description: Donald Trump said repeatedly during his campaign to return to the US presidency that he could quickly negotiate an end to Russia’s war in Ukraine. There’s now concern in Ukraine and among its allies that once Trump is inaugurated in January, the US will back away from supporting the effort to fend off Russian invasion. Officials in countries on NATO’s eastern flank especially worry that if Ukraine is weakened to the point of having to agree to surrender land, it will embolden Russian President V
title: Why Trump’s Promise To End the War Worries Ukraine and Allies

description: European leaders welcomed the prospect of an early election in Germany as a way to break the impasse in Berlin that could help their common project to advance.
title: EU Sees German Vote as Chance for New Start After Trump Win

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Europe Has a Germany Problem in New Trump Era

description: Switzerland’s president said talks on a new political deal with the European Union should be completed soon, signaling confidence that the country can steady relations with its largest trading partner after a previous effort fell apart.
title: Swiss President Says EU Talks Are Getting Close to Conclusion

description: The US election is over and Donald Trump has won a second term as president. Stocks have rallied on Trump’s win, of course, but some of the more interesting moves have taken place in the bond market. Not only have yields on US Treasuries shot up, but expectations for volatility in the world’s most important market were also shifting higher ahead of Trump’s win. All of this is happening even though the Federal Reserve is widely expected to cut benchmark rates again this week. So what’s driving hi
title: Odd Lots: Harley Bassman on Trump, the Fed, and Bonds (Podcast)

description: Emerging-market assets advanced Thursday as optimism over China’s stimulus prospects pushed stocks higher even as traders recalibrated their expectations in the wake of Donald Trump’s US election victory.
title: China Stimulus Optimism Lifts Emerging Markets After Trump Win

description: German opposition leader Friedrich Merz said Chancellor Olaf Scholz should submit to a vote of confidence by early next week at the latest, paving the way for fresh elections as soon as mid-January.
title: German Opposition Leader Wants Confidence Vote by Next Week

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s economic adviser Joerg Kukies will replace Christian Lindner as finance minister, according to a government official, who asked not to be identified discussing confidential planning.
title: Scholz Economic Adviser Kukies to Become New Finance Minister

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s fractious coalition struggled to stem a massive capital drain, which threatens to accelerate after Donald Trump’s re-election.
title: The €650 Billion Exodus at the Heart of Germany's Political Turmoil

description: Chinese social media users hailed Donald Trump’s stunning presidential comeback, while acknowledging the Republican’s political revival likely meant more turbulence for the world’s No. 2 economy.
title: Chinese Social Media Buzzes With Admiration for Trump’s Comeback

description: Mozambique’s main opposition leader abandoned plans to return to the country as the authorities brace for a surge in protests over the results of last month’s disputed election.
title: Mozambican Opposition Head Scraps Plan to Return Before Protest

description: On this episode of In the City, former ambassador Nigel Sheinwald says Keir Starmer’s approach to the US should be “cautious and careful.”
title: What Does Trump’s Victory Mean for UK-US Relations?

description: European Union leaders will get their first chance on Thursday to test whether Donald Trump’s victory can help to unlock the difficult decisions required to strengthen their role in the world.
title: EU Grapples With Trump Win at Orban-Hosted Summit: What to Watch

description: Estonia’s prime minister said that support for Ukraine in the months ahead will shape the future of the European Union as he urged his colleagues to do more to protect Kyiv and themselves.
title: Ukraine’s Fate Will Shape the Future of the EU, Estonia Says

description: Bruce Springsteen has opened his concert with a song he described as a "fighting prayer" for the US, following the election.
title: Bruce Springsteen Opens Post-Election Concert With 'Fighting Prayer' for US

description: With Vice President Kamala Harris’s defeat in the US elections, Indian media are turning their attention to another woman of South Asian descent who’s gaining prominence in American politics.
title: Indians Highlight Usha Vance’s South Asian Roots After Kamala Harris Loses US Election

description: Australia’s Ambassador to the US Kevin Rudd has revealed that he deleted a number of social media posts in which he had been critical of Donald Trump, aiming for a clean slate in ties with the now president-elect.
title: Australian Ambassador to US Rudd Deletes Posts Critical of Trump

description: Few leaders in Asia are more happy to see Donald Trump heading back to the White House than Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
title: Trump Victory Gives Modi Chance to Reset India’s Image With West

description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said he and Donald Trump agreed to have their first in-person meeting soon, after Trump won his second term as US president in an election Tuesday.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Aims to Meet Trump Soon After First Phone Call

description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang pledged to support Myanmar’s government during a rare sitdown with junta chief Min Aung Hlaing, a sign Beijing is seeking to stabilize a regime losing ground in a worsening civil conflict.
title: China’s Premier Vows Support for Myanmar in Junta Chief Meeting

description: A California ballot measure to authorize $10 billion in bonds for K-12 schools and community colleges passed, reflecting a renewed commitment to improving the state’s educational infrastructure amid declining enrollment and a growing teacher shortage.
title: California Approves $10 Billion Bond for School Improvements: AP

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol and US President-elect Donald Trump discussed the presence of North Korean troops in Russia during a phone conversation that comes amid growing concern about Pyongyang’s deepening military cooperation with Moscow.
title: South Korea’s Yoon Discusses Pyongyang’s Troop Moves With Trump

description: China extended its congratulations to Donald Trump for his victory in the US election, while the president-elect reportedly spoke on the phone with Chinese leader Xi Jinping.
title: China Congratulates Trump as Ties Set to Enter New Phase

description: New Zealand’s coalition government has introduced legislation to define the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi, the 1840 agreement between indigenous Māori and the British Crown that is considered the nation’s founding document.
title: NZ Government Introduces Controversial Bill on Founding Treaty

description: Children in Australia under the age of 16 will be banned from social media as part of a push to protect young people’s mental health, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said, with firms involved required to enforce the new regulations or face potential fines.
title: Australia to Ban Social Media for Children Under Age 16, PM Says
